aNews

06 Aug 2015

I will be starting as an assistant professor of EECS at the University of Michigan in Fall 2017. Until then, I will be working as a researcher in the Systems and Networking group at Microsoft Research in Cambridge (Jul. 2016).

  • I received the Roger Needham PhD Award for the best PhD thesis in computer systems in Europe (Apr. 2016)
  • Our paper on automated root cause diagnosis will be presented at SOSP’15 (Oct. 2015)
  • I will serve as a reviewer for ACM Transactions on Software Engineering and Methodology TOSEM. (Aug. 2015)
  • I will serve as a reviewer for ACM Transactions on Software Engineering TSE. (Jul. 2015)
  • Our paper on failure sketches will be presented at HotOS’15. (May 2015)
  • I will be spending the summer at Intel working together with Cristiano Pereira and Gilles Pokam on new techniques for automated debugging and security applications of hardware tracing. (Apr. 2015)
